sen.j: 国一揆（くにいっき）は南北朝時代 (日本)、室町時代の領主による領主権の確保を目的とした連合形態（一揆）を言う。
sen.e: "Uprising in a province" refers to the alliance (uprising) made up of feudal lords aiming at securing the ruling right.
Kuni ikki refers to an alliance (uprising) made up of feudal lords with the aim of securing their rule.
Kuni ikki refers to an alliance (uprising) made up of feudal lords with the aim of securing their rule in the period of Northern and Southern courts and Muromachi.
sen.cmt: 「南北朝時代 (日本)、室町時代の」を追加

sen.j: 国一揆が形成される要因のひとつとして外部からの政治的圧力の介入などが挙げられる。
sen.e: One of the factors that caused uprising in a province was interference by political pressure from outside.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: One factor causing an uprising in a province was interference by political pressure from outside.
sen.cmt: changed "One of the factors" to "One factor"
sen.e: One factor causing an uprising in a province was interference by political pressure from outside.

sen.j: それらに対抗する為の軍事的共同形態的な結び付きが強く、目的が達成される、あるいは脅威が去った際には国一揆は解体される。
sen.e: The alliance was tight-knit like a military partnership aiming at countering the interference, and it was dissolved when it achieved its goal or when the threat disappeared.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Alliances made in an uprising were tight-knit like a military partnership aiming at countering the interference, and they dissolved when the goal was achieved or when the threat disappeared.

sen.j: 代表的な国一揆として伊賀惣国一揆、加賀一向一揆などが挙げられる。
sen.e: Iga sokoku ikki and the uprising of IKKO sect followers in Kaga were typical cases of uprising in a province.
Typical cases of a Kuni ikki were the Iga sokoku ikki and the uprising of the IKKO sect followers in Kaga.

sen.j: 一定の政治的意図をもって上から組織される場合（南九州国人一揆など）
sen.e: It was organized from the top with a certain political intention (e.g. Kokuji rising in southern Kyushu).
The uprising was organized by top authorities with a certain political intention (e.g. the Kokujin uprising in southern Kyushu).

sen.j: 新任の守護に軍事的に対抗し組織される場合（安芸国人一揆など）
sen.e: It was organized to counter the new Shugo (e.g. Kokujin rising in Aki Province).
The uprising was organized in order to oppose a new Shugo (e.g. the Kokujin rising in Aki province).
